noteR.para: To avoid all risk of damage to the systems, apply the safety and cleanliness instructions and operation recommendations before carrying out any repair engine : precautions for the repair GIEMR-001545 .
It is strictly forbidden to apply any pressure to the engine oil sump. Damage to the sump may also damage the engine by:

ul.li: blocking the strainer,
raising the oil level above maximum, with a risk of engine racing.

descbody.para: Remove the engine - gearbox assembly engine and gearbox assembly : removal - refitting GIEMR-001096 .
Place the engine on the component support component support equipment : use GIEMR-001522 .
Remove the crankshaft crankshaft : removal - refitting GIEMR-002404 .

ul.li:
clean the crankshaft withSurface cleaner
vehicle : parts and consumables for the repair GIEMR-002445 and dry using acompressed air nozzle,
check that the crankshaft does not have any scratches, any trace of impact or abnormal wear (if necessary replace the crankshaft).

stentry.para: Diameter category of journal no. 1, at flywheel end
Diameter category of journal no. 5, at timing end
Diameter category of crankpin no. 1, at flywheel end
Diameter category of crankpin no. 4, at timing end

description.title: Diameter classes of the crankshaft journals and crankpins
Diameter classes of the crankshaft journals and crankpins
Diameter classes of the crankshaft journals and crankpins
Diameter classes of the crankshaft journals and crankpins
Check the diameter of the crankshaft journals

descsection.para: Use aexternal micrometerto measure the diameter (in the centre of the mating face) of the crankshaft journal to be checked, which must be between 47.990 and 48.010 mm .
Compare the value measured with the diameter class marked on the crankshaft (see Identification of the crankshaft and Diameter class of the crankshaft journals ).

description.title: Checking the diameter of the crankshaft crankpins

descsection.para: Use aexternal micrometerto measure the diameter (in the centre of the mating face) of the crankshaft crankpin to be checked, which must be between 43.960 and 43.980 mm .
Compare the value measured with the diameter class marked on the crankshaft (see Identification of the crankshaft and Diameter class of the crankshaft crankpins ).

description.title: Identification of the crankshaft bearing shells

noteR.para: The crankshaft bearing shells are the type "without foolproofing devices" .

descsection.para: The crankshaft bearing shells are fitted on the cylinder block and the bearings using the Crankshaft bearing tool. Mot.1493-01 .
Positioning of the crankshaft bearing shells:

ul.li: in the cylinder block, fit the grooved bearing shells on all the bearings,
on the crankshaft bearing caps, fit the grooved bearing shells onto bearing caps numbers No. 2 - 4 , and the non-grooved bearing shells onto bearing caps numbers No. 1 - 3 - 5 .

table.title: Matching the journal bearing shells to the cylinder block

noteR.para: Do not rotate the crankshaft during this check.

descbody.para: Remove any oil that may be on the crankshaft journals and cylinder block bearings.
Refit without lubricating crankshaft : removal - refitting GIEMR-002404 :

ul.li: the crankshaft bearing grooved bearing shells onto the cylinder block,
the grooved bearing shells onto the bearing caps No. 2-4 ,
the non-grooved bearing shells onto the bearing caps No. 1 - 3 - 5 .
the crankshaft,
the crankshaft thrust washers on bearing No.3 (grooves at crankshaft end).

descsection.para: Cut pieces ofradial play measuring tape.
Position the wire7in the axis of the crankshaft journal avoiding the bearing lubrication holes.

descbody.para: Refit without lubricating crankshaft : removal - refitting GIEMR-002404 :

ul.li: the "crankshaft bearing shell - bearing cap" assemblies,
the old crankshaft bearing cap bolts.
the old crankshaft bearing bolts,
the "crankshaft bearing shell - bearing cap" assemblies.

descsection.para: Measure the flattening of theradial play measuring tapewhich must be between 0.027 and 0.054 mm using the gauge printed on the wire packaging8.

descbody.para: Clean off of any remaining parts of the measuring wire on the crankshaft and bearing shells.

description.title: Thickness of the crankshaft thrust washer

descsection.para: There are two shim thicknesses: 2.80 mm and 2.85 mm .

noteR.para: Only lubricate the side of the crankshaft bearing shells that comes in contact with the crankshaft.

ul.li: the crankshaft bearing grooved bearing shells onto the cylinder block,
the grooved bearing shells onto the bearing caps No. 2-4 ,
the non-grooved bearing shells onto the bearing caps No. 1 - 3 - 5 .
the crankshaft,
the crankshaft thrust washers on bearing No. 3 (grooves at crankshaft end),
the "crankshaft bearing shell - bearing cap" assemblies,
the old crankshaft bearing bolts.
thedial gauge support,
theDial gaugeon the mounting.

descsection.para: Support the feeler of theDial gaugeon the flywheel face of the crankshaft.
Support the crankshaft on the thrust washer by pushing the crankshaft in the axis towards the timing end.
Support the crankshaft on the other thrust washer by pushing the crankshaft in the axis towards the flywheel end.
Check the lateral clearance of the crankshaft, which must be:

ul.li: without thrust washer wear: 0.045 to 0.252 mm ,
with thrust washer wear: 0.045 to 0.852 mm .

descbody.para: Remove the crankshaft crankshaft : removal - refitting GIEMR-002404 .
Refit the crankshaft crankshaft : removal - refitting GIEMR-002404 .
Remove the engine from the component support component support equipment : use GIEMR-001522 .
Refit the "engine - gearbox" assembly engine and gearbox assembly : removal - refitting GIEMR-001096 ,
